info.description:
The GS1 UK Experimental GTIN Application Programming Interface Testing Service is a prototype service that is made
available to specific GS1 UK members with the aim of fast-checking thousands of barcoded product data.
A GTIN (global trade item number) is the name of the barcode value uniquely identifying each product.
Previous names for the GTIN are EAN in Europe and UPC in the USA. This checker works to test:
1. That each GTIN has the correct integrity; that is, it is the right length, in the correct format, and with the correct syntactical makeup.
2. The GTIN’s prefix value is correctly assigned to correct GS1 UK member.
3. The GTIN’s prefix value is correctly assigned to correct member in the world where we have this information.
4. The product’s description matches – or mostly matches – a product description that GS1 UK has on file, where we have this information.
The API allows thousands of GTIN values to be sent and tested in real-time. This interface uses standard web API principles:
1. A POST request interface over secure web HTTP
2. Data values accepted in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format
3. A response also in JSON format
In order to provide security and controlled access, only members who have been provided
with an appropriate ‘key’ may access the service at this time.
The prototype nature of this service means that users must accept occasional errors and performance issues from time to time.
Therefore this checker is provided on an ‘as-is’ basis.
However, members involved in using this service are able to help shape it in a manner that fits best with their
GTIN-checking requirements, with fast development-time turnaround. Working together we can shape the correct product with
a view to a future production system.
info.name: GTINcheck
